bgu.spl.mics

Interface MessageBus

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageBusImpl

    public interface MessageBus
    The message-bus is a shared object used for communication between micro-services. It should be implemented as a thread-safe singleton. The message-bus implementation must be thread-safe as it is shared between all the micro-services in the system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Message awaitMessage(MicroService m)
      using this method, a registered micro-service can take message from its allocated queue.
      <T> void complete(Request<T> r, T result)
      Notifying the MessageBus that the request r is completed and its result was result.
      void register(MicroService m)
      allocates a message-queue for the MicroService m.
      void sendBroadcast(Broadcast b)
      add the Broadcast b to the message queues of all the micro-services subscribed to b.getClass().
      boolean sendRequest(Request<?> r, MicroService requester)
      add the Request r to the message queue of one of the micro-services subscribed to r.getClass() in a round-robin fashion.
      void subscribeBroadcast(java.lang.Class<? extends Broadcast> type, MicroService m)
      subscribes m to receive Broadcasts of type type.
      void subscribeRequest(java.lang.Class<? extends Request> type, MicroService m)
      subscribes m to receive Requests of type type.
      void unregister(MicroService m)
      remove the message queue allocated to m via the call to register(bgu.spl.mics.MicroService) and clean all references related to m in this message-bus.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribeRequest

        void subscribeRequest(java.lang.Class<? extends Request> type,
                      MicroService m)
        subscribes m to receive Requests of type type.

        Parameters:
        type - the type to subscribe to
        m - the subscribing micro-service

      • subscribeBroadcast

        void subscribeBroadcast(java.lang.Class<? extends Broadcast> type,
                        MicroService m)
        subscribes m to receive Broadcasts of type type.

        Parameters:
        type - the type to subscribe to
        m - the subscribing micro-service

      • complete

        <T> void complete(Request<T> r,
                  T result)
        Notifying the MessageBus that the request r is completed and its result was result. When this method is called, the message-bus will implicitly add the special RequestCompleted message to the queue of the requesting micro-service, the RequestCompleted message will also contain the result of the request (result).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the result expected by the completed request
        Parameters:
        r - the completed request
        result - the result of the completed request

      • sendBroadcast

        void sendBroadcast(Broadcast b)
        add the Broadcast b to the message queues of all the micro-services subscribed to b.getClass().

        Parameters:
        b - the message to add to the queues.

      • sendRequest

        boolean sendRequest(Request<?> r,
                    MicroService requester)
        add the Request r to the message queue of one of the micro-services subscribed to r.getClass() in a round-robin fashion.

        Parameters:
        r - the request to add to the queue.
        requester - the MicroService sending r.
        Returns:
        true if there was at least one micro-service subscribed to r.getClass() and false otherwise.

      • register

        void register(MicroService m)
        allocates a message-queue for the MicroService m.

        Parameters:
        m - the micro-service to create a queue for.

      • unregister

        void unregister(MicroService m)
        remove the message queue allocated to m via the call to register(bgu.spl.mics.MicroService) and clean all references related to m in this message-bus. If m was not registered, nothing should happen.

        Parameters:
        m - the micro-service to unregister.

      • awaitMessage

        Message awaitMessage(MicroService m)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        using this method, a registered micro-service can take message from its allocated queue. This method is blocking -meaning that if no messages are available in the micro-service queue it should wait until a message became available. The method should throw the IllegalStateException in the case where m was never registered.

        Parameters:
        m - the micro-service requesting to take a message from its message queue
        Returns:
        the next message in the m's queue (blocking)
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting for a message to became available.
